Package ohos.media.audio

Class AudioInterrupt

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.audio.AudioInterrupt

  • public class AudioInterrupt
extends Object
    An audio interruption management mechanism used to resolve audio playback conflicts among multiple applications.

    If you want to reduce the volume of background audio, set the AUDIO_STREAM_FLAG_MAY_DUCK flag in AudioStreamInfo. If you want to resume playing the background audio after the interruption ends, set the AUDIO_STREAM_FLAG_MAY_RESUME flag in AudioStreamInfo.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    AudioManager.activateAudioInterrupt(AudioInterrupt), AudioManager.deactivateAudioInterrupt(AudioInterrupt)
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#AUDIO

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  AudioInterrupt.InterruptListener
      Listens for an audio interruption message.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int INTERRUPT_HINT_DUCK
      Indicates a prompt for the application to duck audio playback.
      static int INTERRUPT_HINT_NONE
      Indicates that there is no prompt.
      static int INTERRUPT_HINT_PAUSE
      Indicates a prompt for the application to pause audio playback.
      static int INTERRUPT_HINT_RESUME
      Indicates a prompt for the application to resume playing audio.
      static int INTERRUPT_HINT_STOP
      Indicates a prompt for the application to stop audio playback.
      static int INTERRUPT_HINT_UNDUCK
      Indicates a prompt for the application to unduck audio playback.
      static int INTERRUPT_TYPE_BEGIN
      Indicates that the interruption starts.
      static int INTERRUPT_TYPE_END
      Indicates that the interruption ends.

      • setPauseWhenDucked

        public void setPauseWhenDucked​(boolean pauseWhenDucked)
        Sets whether audio playback can be paused during audio ducking.
        Parameters:
        pauseWhenDucked - Specifies whether audio playback can be paused. Value true indicates that audio playback can be paused during audio ducking, and false indicates the opposite.
